title: Child Injured in Accidental Shooting
content:
Error loading player: No playable sources found
ST. JOSEPH, Mo.
An accidental shooting in south St. Joseph sent one child to the hospital Thursday night.
The St. Joseph police were called to a home on the 3400 block of S. 16th Street after a babysitter called 911 to report bleeding from a child's face.
Officers responded and found what they say was an apparent gunshot wound to the child's eye.
"It's still under investigation but at this point it appears to be an accidental shooting in the eye," Capt. Richard Eaton with the St. Joseph Police Department said.
The child was transported to Mosaic Life Care and later to Children's Mercy Hospital for treatment.
The shooting is still under investigation at this time.
